intro: Cyrtandra tahitensis, commonly known as Tahitian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lanceolate leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
